info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 8:05PM EDT until July 05 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Cleveland County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Gaston County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Union County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... York County in Upstate South Carolina... Northeastern Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 804 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Shelby to 9 miles west of Albemarle, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Rock Hill, Uptown Charlotte, Downtown Concord, Monroe, Shelby, York, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte and Northeast Charlotte. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Lake Wylie, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
